title: Electromagnetism - force on loop entering B field

content.prompt: Which of the following correctly indicates the direction of the net magnetic force on the loop and provides a valid justification?

choices.label: To the left, because a leftward force is exerted on Segment R, no force is exerted on Segment T, and the forces exerted on Segment Q and Segment S are equal and opposite
To the left, because a leftward force is exerted on both Segment Q and Segment S, and no forces are exerted on Segment R and Segment T
No direction, because the velocity of the loop is constant and therefore no magnetic forces are exerted on any of the loop segments
No direction, because the forces exerted on opposite segments are equal and opposite and therefore the net force on the loop is zero

skill.text: 3.C: Justify or support a claim using evidence from experimental data, physical representations, or physical principles or laws.
